0.locationInformation: This French-influenced nation in South East Asia offers visitors peaceful rural scenery, golden beaches and a distinct cultural heritage. Vietnam’s climate differs with the north having a cooler season while the southern coastline is warm all year round. Open your curtains at around 6am year round to views of stunning Halong Bay or to catch the traditional floating market on the Mekong Delta.

1.locationInformation: Take a trip to Central Asia to discover the abundant green valleys, mountainous landscapes and glitzy cities of oil rich Kazakhstan. Awake at 5am in summer for a warm dawn walk along the impressive Charyn Canyon, or enjoy watching the sun creep up over the picturesque snow-capped peaks surrounding the Almaty Lake at 9am in winter.

2.locationInformation: A luxury destination for both honeymooners and families, the Maldives in the Indian Ocean are as close as you’ll get to paradise. With a tropical climate, these 26 coral atolls are bathed in warmth all year round with the occasional downpour during monsoon season. Open the curtains of your water bungalow to watch the sun rise over the ocean at 6am every morning.

3.locationInformation: The crown jewel of the United Arab Emirates, Dubai is a glamorous multicultural city that sprawls in between the Persian Gulf and the Arabian Desert. Open your curtains to glorious sunrises across the bay from the towering Burj Khalifa at 5am in summer, or take a 6am stroll around the Palm Jumeriah in the pleasant 15˚C winter temperatures.

4.locationInformation: The largest country in the world, Russia is made up of vast dramatic landscapes, beautiful architecture and plenty of fascinating history. In mid-winter, it drops below freezing and the sprinkling of snow on Moscow’s colourful buildings can be admired at late 10am sunrises. In summer, the imperial port city of St Petersburg with its historic canals and museums is shrouded in sunlight as early as 3.30am.

image.location: The Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood, St. Petersburg
The State Historical Museum of Russia, Moscow

5.locationInformation: Forming the southern tip of Africa, this incredible nation is known for being a safari hotspot. A temperate location with rarely any extreme weather, visitors can spot animals on the vast plains, indulge in wine tasting in Stellenbosch or take in the views atop Table Mountain. Open your curtains between 5.30 and 7am to rainbow sunrises over the luscious Drakensburg Mountains or the vast farms surrounding Port Elizabeth.

image.author: Bryn Lake
image.location: Port Elizabeth on a family farm

6.locationInformation: Known as the city of love, Paris is teeming with cultural history and creativity as well as being one of the warmest locations in northern France. Wander the boulevards at dawn in the summer to see the deserted Eiffel Tower, or awake with the sun at 8.45 in December for warming hot chocolate and croissants on the Rue Saint-Honoré.

7.locationInformation: The capital of the UK with a grand mix of historic sites and iconic contemporary architecture, London is a metropolis like no other. Admire the sun creeping up into the sky over deserted waterways and canals at 5am in summer, or watch commuters making their way to work around majestic Trafalgar Square at dawn in December.

8.locationInformation: Situated off the west coast of Africa in the vast Atlantic Ocean, the Cape Verde archipelago is a paradise of golden beaches, volcanic rock formations, brightly coloured houses, and abundant valleys of exotic flowers. Temperatures here rarely drop below 20˚C in the day, making the spectacular 6-7am sunsets over Boa Vista Harbour a pleasant and unmissable experience.

9.locationInformation: Made up of nearly 80% ice, Greenland is largely untouched with only a scattering of colourful towns and Inuit villages among the snow-capped mountains and fjords. Stay up all night in winter to admire the magical Aurora Borealis before the 10am sunrise, or open your curtains and windows to the fresh dawn air at 3am in summer.

10.locationInformation: The largest of the South American countries, hot and humid Brazil is made up of vast tropical rainforests, endless golden beaches and a growing number of multicultural cities. Awake at 6am to breath-taking views across Rio de Janeiro, or emerge from your jungle lodge in the Amazon to the luscious greenery of the largest collection of plants on the planet.

11.locationInformation: Forming part of the luscious Caribbean islands, the Dominican Republic is a geographically diverse nation with over a hundred miles of stunning coastline. With an average year round temperature of 25˚C, open your curtains between 6 and 7am for a glorious sunrise over white sand beaches or the vibrant jungle fringing exotic Santa Domingo.

12.locationInformation: The appeal of the Big Apple speaks for itself with its iconic skyline, stunning parks and bountiful attractions. Discover why New York is the city that never sleeps by waking up at 5.30am on a warm July morning to watch the sunrise from Brooklyn Bridge, or to wander through the already bustling streets of snowy Manhattan at 7.30am in the crisp winter months.

13.locationInformation: There’s far more to balmy Mexico than its vast deserts and stunning beaches. With hot temperatures all year round, venture up the mountains for a cooling breeze and awake with the sun every morning at 7am to peaceful lagoons or the deserted streets of historic Mexico City.

image.location: Republica de Brasil Street, Mexico City

14.locationInformation: A northerly state of the US, Idaho is best known for its impressive mountain ranges and untouched wilderness. With four distinct seasons, wake up for an 8am sunrise on a frozen December morning in Boise or open your curtains at 6am to spectacular views of Sawtooth Fire Ridge during the height of summer.

15.locationInformation: The capital of sunny California and the home of some of the world’s biggest movie stars, Los Angeles is a sprawling city with a temperate climate all year round. Wake up with the sun between 6-7 am for a stroll along Santa Monica’s beaches or open your curtains to views of the iconic Hollywood hills.

16.locationInformation: Known as the least populated yet largest US state, northerly Alaska is the ideal destination for outdoor adventures due to its stunning landscapes. Awake with the sun leisurely late at 10am in winter, or refreshingly early in summer at 4.20am to snow-capped peaks, frozen glaciers and clear blue bays.

image.location: Chilkat River and Coast Mountains, Wells

17.locationInformation: A group of islands located off the west coast of America, tropical Hawaii is known for its vibrant beach culture, iconic national dance and multi-cultural vibe. With the weather staying warm all year round, wake up to a paradise of rainforests and waterfalls as the sun creeps into the sky between 6 and 7am.

18.locationInformation: Located in the middle of the Pacific Ocean, American Samoa is one of the many stunning Polynesian archipelagos that boasts white palm-fringed beaches, dramatic rocky backdrops and lush green rainforest interiors. With a tropical climate and temperatures rarely dipping below 20˚C, open your curtains between 6 and 7am year round to watch the sunrise over the clear blue ocean waters.

19.locationInformation: Known for having more sheep than humans, New Zealand is defined by green landscapes, metropolitan cities and volcanic mountains on the North Island, and stunning lakes in the South. Wake to fresh views across Lake Rotoroa for a 7.45am sunrise in winter, or experience a peaceful dawn walk through the long golden grass of Molesworth Station in summer.

image.author: Sharlene Laskey
image.location: Lake Rotoroa, Nelson Lakes National Park

20.locationInformation: Far from being a tourist trap, the untouched coastline of the Solomon Islands is a reminder of the laid-back way of life of the Pacific. Near the equator, they have consistently warm temperatures and typically 12 hours of sun a day. Start the day off at dawn with a 6am dive to awe at colourful fire coral, or open your curtains to see locals fishing on the peaceful lagoons.

21.locationInformation: The largest city in Australia and one of the friendliest in the world, Sydney boasts a lively cultural scene, luscious national parks as well as being fringed with spectacular beaches. With temperate weather all year round, watch the sun come up over the Tasman Sea from the famous Bondi Baths at 6am in summer, or open up your curtains to cool morning views across Sydney Harbour in winter.

22.locationInformation: A nation of opposites, Japan is awed at for both its futuristic clean cities and its beautiful cherry blossom filled landscapes. This island country has two distinct seasons with snow filled winters and humid summers. Open your curtains in winter to views of frosty Mount Fuji or experience Japan’s hectic city vibe in the height of summer.

23.locationInformation: Unlike other South East Asian nations, the 7000 islands of the Philippines are defined by their Spanish heritage and Catholic beliefs. Besides from sprawling cities and Hispanic architecture, its tropical islands are full of idyllic paddy fields, endless beaches and friendly natives. Open your tent to a 6am sunrise on El Nido during the drier winter months, or watch the dawn settle over metropolitan Manila.
